conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows extruded walls with visible thickness and interior vertical faces; camera is slightly tilted from top-down (not perfectly orthographic), and the ceiling/roof is removed to reveal interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and coherent room volumes; cutaway is clean. View is only mildly angled (mostly top-down), limiting visibility of exterior side faces and reducing spatial depth cues.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Room count and adjacency match well (living/dining left, balcony bottom-left, bedroom bottom-right, toilet mid-right, kitchen top, utility top-right). Proportions largely consistent; minor deviations in opening placement/partition detailing vs the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present: sofa/TV/coffee table, dining set, bed, kitchen counters/sink/hob, toilet and basin. Mostly placed in correct rooms with reasonable scale; some simplification and minor orientation differences.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with consistent materials and lighting; no major mesh breaks. Slightly flat presentation due to near-top view, but openings and room separations remain clear; clean background with no UI/text contamination.

detected_errors.description: Some door/window/opening details do not exactly match the 2D plan (e.g., swing/positioning appears simplified or slightly shifted).
Viewing angle is close to top-down, reducing multi-surface wall visibility and weakening depth perception compared to a stronger isometric cutaway.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with largely faithful room layout and furnishings, with minor opening mismatches and a camera angle that is more top-down than ideal for isometric depth.
